alert.note: Alert for Grady; McClain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 2:54AM CDT until July 11 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, northwest, and southwest Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, Canadian, Grady, Kingfisher and McClain. In northwest Oklahoma, Blaine. In southwest Oklahoma, Caddo. * WHEN...Until 600 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 254 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southwestern Oklahoma City, El Reno, Newcastle, Blanchard, Yukon, Mustang, Tuttle, Hinton, Union City, Minco, Geary, Okarche, Hydro, Binger, Calumet, Amber, Eakly, Bridge Creek, Gracemont and Lookeba.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
